enter_url_password: Enter the password to generate encrypted url.
passphrase_created:
We have created a passphrase for you in the box below.
This passphrase lets you access your wallet and the funds it contains.
write_your_passphrase: Write your passphrase down and keep it safe.
if_you_lose_passphrase: If you lose this passphrase, you will lose access to your wallet forever.
if_someone_get_passphrase: If someone gets your passphrase, they gain access to your wallet.
we_do_not_store_your_passphrase: We do not store your passphrase and cannot recover it if lost.
i_have_written_passphrase: I have <u>written down</u> or otherwise <u>securely stored</u> my passphrase.
quick_access_intro_1: To avoid having to type the full 12-word passphrase every time you log into Counterwallet, you can optionally use a special Quick Access URL that is produced by entering a password of your choosing.
quick_access_intro_2: If you don't know what this means, just click Skip This Step below.
copy_down_secret_url: Copy down the following secret URL and use with your password for quick access:
new_to_counterwallet: New to Counterwallet, and want to just play around?
dev_mode_enabled: Dev Mode Enabled
counterwallet_desc_1: Counterwallet is a web-wallet for Counterparty, the world’s first protocol for decentralized financial tools.
counterwallet_desc_2: All transactions made with Counterwallet use an automatic escrow system to keep them secure, with no middleman required.
counterwallet_desc_4: All encryption is handled client-side. Neither your passphrase nor any of your private information ever leaves your browser.
counterwallet_desc_5: Counterwallet passhrases are highly secure, so you know that your wallet is safe from all brute force attacks. They are also easy to learn and hard to mistype.
counterwallet_desc_7: With Counterwallet, your passphrase is your wallet, and all of your addresses and keys are generated on-the-fly when you log in.
counterwallet_desc_8: There are no wallet files to backup or keep private, and with your passphrase you can access your wallet from any trusted machine with a web browser.
counterwallet_desc_10: Counterwallet and Counterwalletd are entirely open-source, so you know that they work exactly the way that they are supposed to.
counterwallet_desc_11: If you like, you may also even run your own Counterwallet server.
is_the_first_time: If you are being asked to accept the Terms and Conditions, this is the first time you are opening this wallet. If you are trying to access an old wallet, you have typed the passphrase incorrectly.
you_must_read: You must read and accept the following agreement in order to use this site:
secure_passphrase_desc: Each text box below corresponds to a word in your 12-word passphrase. To enter your passphrase, click on each box and use the on-screen keyboard that appears, then press the Login button when done. This approach limits the ability that malware and keyloggers have of stealing your passphrase.
choose_your_handle_desc:
To use chat, you must have a handle (or nickname) you wish to use (alphanumeric/underscore/hyphen, between 4 and 12 characters).

Please remember that people in chat may not always be who they seem. Until a verified identity system is implemented for chat, do not simply trust someone is who their handle says they are!
enable_auto_btcpay_desc: If this option is enabled, Counterwallet will automatically take care of making BTC payments for matched orders where you owe BTC. It is highly recommended you keep this on. If not enabled, you must manually settle any required BTC payments within a 10 block limit (approximately 80-100 minutes).
advanced_options_warning:
Don't change followings parameters, unless you know exactly what you are doing.
If you change them, your BTC orders could not match.
These parameters are not persistent.
default_expiration_desc: Blocks until expiration (This is ~6.75 days at ~9 min per block).
default_expiration_btc_desc: Blocks until expiration for selling BTC order.
reset_state_desc: Click this button to reset custom color settings, widget positioning, etc.
show_info_desc: Click to show some useful information for troubleshooting wallet issues.
enter_password_to_crypt: Enter the password to encrypt the passphrase.
click_to_generate_passphrase: Click to generate another random passphrase.
try_the_following: If you are having issues using Counterwallet, please try the following:
support_1: Ask in Counterwallet chat: Click on the Show Chat link on the left menubar, and ask your question there. Someone may know the answer.
support_2: Check out our forums: You can post your question or issue in the Counterparty support forums.
support_3: Open a support ticket: If all else fails, you may open a support ticket.
answers_to_common_questions: Answers to common questions. Just click the one you're interested in:
answer_1: I logged in and my address is different, and I have no balance! Help!
answer_2: I sent funds to a crowdsale vending machine, why didn’t they show up?
answer_3: I sent BTC to Counterwallet, why doesn't it show up?
answer_4: Why do I need small amounts of Bitcoin to do things in Counterwallet?
answer_5: An address I added in Counterwallet is not showing -- why?
answer_9: What does something like “XCP/BTC” mean, in Counterwallet?
answer_11: I placed an order to buy BTC for something else. What I offered was removed from my account, but I don't see the BTC yet!
answer_12: Why does it cost me a little Bitcoin to cancel an order!?
for_other_questions: For other questions, please ask in
donation_desc:
Send a donation to support Counterparty and Counterwallet development.
Counterparty is non-profit, self-funded, open source and community supported. We appreciate any donations, and all donations go directly towards supporting future development.
create_support_case_desc1: Create a support case by filling out the information below.
create_support_case_desc2:
Please only create a case for bugs only.
For questions, check out our knowledge base or ask in our forums.
required_support: Required so that we can provide a response to you.
enter_desc_problem: Enter an in-depth description of your problem
check_to_inclued_screenshot: Check this box to include a screenshot, which helps us better diagnose the issue.
we_get_back_to_you: We will try to get back to you within 24 hours, via email, to the address you have provided.
